intro: Carpolobia delvauxii, commonly known as the African violet, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa. It belongs to the family Gesneriaceae and is characterized by its striking, velvety leaves and showy, tubular flowers. The plant typically grows as an evergreen shrub, reaching heights of up to 1 meter. Its flowers are usually pink or purple and are pollinated by insects such as bees and butterflies. Carpolobia delvauxii is popular as a ornamental plant due to its aesthetic appeal and ease of cultivation.
